channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Time expired road signs, 18th August
item.description:
Both sides at junction of Prince Imperial Road and High Street. Along with the recent repainting of the Hornbrook House carpark on 6 AUGUST (not July Bromley Council!!!) time for replacement please….. As per attached photos…..

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Prince Imperial Road, Chislehurst, London

item.title: Tree branches obscuring road junction, 18th August
item.description:
The tree is located on private land of 116 Southborough lane, at the junction with Woodside road. It is becoming increasingly difficult to exit that junction safely because the tree's foliage obscure the view at the junction, making really difficult when exiting Woodside road to check for oncoming traffic from the RHS of Southborough road. For road safety reason the tree has to be removed permanently and an order be made that low vegetation only is to be allowed on that corner.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodside Road, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 1-27 Brondesbury Park, 18th August
item.description:
From 1-27 Brondesbury Park. This side of the street is NEVER swept, even though a street cleaner sweeps the other side of the street. This has gone on for months and months, despite asking him politely. He done it once a few months ago but refused when asked today. We pay council tax on this side of the street too and he needs to start cleaning this side, it is filthy. He is rude too.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brondesbury Park, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree headroom, 18th August
item.description:
Most of the council trees in The Crescent do not allow the required headroom. The branches are very low. I am 1.6m tall and they hit me on the head. I assume that the rules for private trees also apply to council trees: "trees ... should be cut back to allow at least 2.4m of headroom over the pavement..." Our Bromley, Aug 2025 p 17. Please can this problem be addressed as soon as possible. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Crescent, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 34, 18th August

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Platt's Lane, West Hampstead, London
